intro: Gerbera diversifolia, commonly known as the African gerbera, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that come in a variety of colors, including white, yellow, orange, and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features sturdy, hairy stems. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Gerbera diversifolia is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and as a potted plant.
